The original statement, "The movie must have been in English", asserts that the movie was definitely in the English language. This statement does not provide any information about whether the movie was subtitled or not.

The proposed inference, "The movie must have been subtitled or in English", presents two possibilities: either the movie was subtitled (in a language other than English), or it was in English (without subtitles).

Since the original statement only confirms that the movie was in English, it does not necessarily imply that it was subtitled. The movie could have been in English without any subtitles.

Therefore, the proposed inference introduces an additional possibility (the movie being subtitled) that is not supported by the original statement.
